column4: is there an "official" place to install third-party software that doesn't have a debian package?
Whereever it drops it, basically. But use checkinstall (apt-get this) and instead of running 'make install' run 'checkinstall'
It'll create a deb so you can use apt and dpkg to uninstall it later.
i don't mean things built from source, i mean third-party stuff like matlab
